newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold prices mixed, volume rises.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold prices mixed, volume rises.

text.p: Istanbul gold volume rose to 1,338 kilos on Monday from Friday's 655 kilos on firmer demand, but dealers said trade was still comparatively thin, with a lack of strong buying from the free market.
Gold closed easier in dollar terms at $341.70 an ounce, compared to $342.50 on Friday, but rose in lira terms to 1,601,900 lira per gram versus 1,598,500 lira due to a weaker Turkish lira.

"Trade was still quiet with no great demand coming from the bazaar (Turkey's free gold market is concentrated around Istanbul's Grand Bazaar), traders merely replaced stock sold over the weekend. With little or few opportunites for arbitrage, the banks showed a lack of interest in the market," one dealer said.
The Turkish lira eased to 145,400 lira to the dollar compared to 144,610 on Friday.
Most of the day's trade -- 1,223 kilos -- took place in the morning session with 71.6 percent of trade conducted in lira terms.
